Content.Text:
<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Good evening, everyone, and thank you for
coming out tonight as the year winds down its
last few hours.
<PAGE>
As we do every year, we will now begin our <RED>New
Year's</RED> festivities to ring in the new year.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
This year, we once again have a wonderful
present for all of you.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>In Sakura Country, it's tradition to greet the new
year with a warm bowl of buckwheat noodles,
which is supposed to symbolize long life.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>As a sign of goodwill, the Sakura Country
merchant has given us a special gift of
buckwheat noodles for tonight's festivities.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>We only have a few hours left in this year, so let
us all enjoy this most generous gift.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Mmmmm! So good!
<PAGE>
Man, getting to eat these awesome noodles
every year makes me look forward to New Year's
Eve! We're so lucky!

<FACE_REGER><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Mmm...Interesting. You might not fully
understand why this has such an exquisite
flavor, but it sure is great, isn't it?
<PAGE>
The broth, the noodles...everything is perfect.
Just what you'd expect when they're made at the
source. I've gotta practice more to hit that level.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
What an appetizing fragrance. Bonito and kombu
along with...hmm, is that sardine I smell? Such
a decadent broth...

<FACE_IRIS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
It is. The broth really warms me up, and the
noodles are just the right firmness, too. It really
is very good.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Haha...for a novelist, that was a surprisingly
nondescript way of putting it.

<FACE_IRIS><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
I suppose it was! Whenever I eat something
delicious, my mind gets so caught up in the
flavor that my vocabulary takes a meal break!

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I feel as though its warmth spreads through my
body, even to my fingertips. Nothing tastes
better than warm soup on a cold night.

<FACE_MENOU><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
Eating warm buckwheat noodles on New Year's
night is great. Sakura Country's customs sure
are neat.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>But...I have such a sensitive tongue, I'm going
to have to blow on these a bit to cool them
down enough to eat.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Good timing. I was just kinda craving a snack,
actually.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Sampling a dish enjoyed by the common folk
isn't so bad, every now and then. It has a warm,
comforting quality about it.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Yeah. I'm definitely feeling warmer now. The real
question is...can we grab seconds?

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I've had New Year's noodles in my old hometown
before, but these are even better.
<PAGE>
The broth and even the noodles are a bit
different, I think. I guess it doesn't stick around
as a tradition without being great.

<FACE_LICORICE><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Mmm. These ARE good. Since they're straight
from Sakura Country, I'm betting these are the
"real thing."

<FACE_LILIE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Mmmm, these are so yummy! Mmph! Still
pretty hot, but what's a little tongue burn in the
face of such deliciousness?

<FACE_MELTY><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
You don't have to slurp them up so fast, you
know. It's not like someone's going to come take
them away.

<FACE_LILIE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
I'm not eating too fast! I just said they were a
little on the hot side.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Besides, they're so good I couldn't help myself.
You should take care not to burn your mouth,
though.

<FACE_MELTY><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
I won't! Unlike a certain someone, I already made
sure mine were cool enough to eat first. ♪

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Mother, you should have some of these
buckwheat noodles. They have all the essential
amino acids, as well as antioxidants.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
I will, of course. I just want to make sure
everyone enjoys this wonderful meal.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>And please do enjoy your fill, everyone. There is
more than enough to go around.

<FACE_GEORGES><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
<WINDOW_ROSE_R>I find buckwheat noodles to be a terribly plain
dish, but buckwheat flowers? Now those are a
beautiful sight!
<PAGE>
When they bloom, they can carpet a whole field
in gleaming white. Simply fabulous.

<FACE_MARIAN><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
The noodles do look rather plain, yes, but from a
doctor's standpoint, they're an excellent source
of nutrition for both body and inner beauty.
<PAGE>
They're antiarteriosclerotic, fortify capillaries, are
anti-diabetic, reduce both blood pressure and
cholesterol and--

<FACE_GEORGES><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
<WINDOW_DISCOURAGEMENT_R>All right, all right! Just eat them, would you? In
the time it takes you to rattle off all those big
words, they'll go cold.

<FACE_MORRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hard to believe this year'll be over soon. We've
made it through a lot so far, but we ought to
give next year our best, too.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Aye. We're just gettin' started, so let's have fun
with our work and work hard at our leisure, I
say. Let's give this go-around our best again.

<FACE_MORRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I hear you. These noodles are really good, by the
way.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
Yep. Sakura Country's got a knack for makin'
noodles. They've got a nice, rich flavor, but a
clean taste.

<FACE_OTMAR><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Now these are some good noodles! I was
thinking about staying home because it's so
dag-blamed cold out here...
<PAGE>
But now I'm glad I came, because I got to sit
here and slurp some noodles with you all.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
Glad you came too, Gramps!

<FACE_OTMAR><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I am too! By the way...What's all the hooplah
about? Is today some sort of holiday?

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
...

<FACE_JONAS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
How are you liking those noodles, Lutz?

<FACE_LUTZ><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
They're very good. But...why do we do this for
New Year's?

<FACE_JONAS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
That's, well... You see, there's a custom in
Sakura Country...

<FACE_LUTZ><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
What kind of custom?

<FACE_CHLOE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Because buckwheat noodles are so thin and
long, people see them as a symbol of long life,
so eating them on New Year's is good luck.

<FACE_MARGOT><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Some also say that, since these are softer and
easier to cut than other noodles, eating them on
New Year's will help "cut away" bad luck.

<FACE_CHLOE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Wow, you sure know a lot about this. I'm always
glad to pick up another nugget of knowledge.
Thanks!

<FACE_MARGOT><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hmph. That's hardly what I'd call knowledge
worth getting excited about...

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
All right, everyone. Did you enjoy the buckwheat
noodles?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>The final minutes of the year are upon us. Are
you all ready to count down to the new year?
<FONT_SIZE_LL>　　　<RED>5!</RED>
<FONT_SIZE_LL>　　　<RED>4!</RED>
<FONT_SIZE_LL>　　　<RED>3!</RED>
<FONT_SIZE_LL>　　　<RED>2!</RED>
<FONT_SIZE_LL>　　　<RED>1!</RED>
<FONT_SIZE_LL>　　　<RED>0!</RED>
<FONT_SIZE_L> Happy New Yeeeear!

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Happy New Year, everyone. May the year to
come bring even greater happiness and
prosperity to us all!
Let's have another great year!
